Message.Msg: also known as the Amazon chart (in a few weeks?).
haven't plunged over the falls (yet). A few things will have to line up for that to occur.

Topic.Title: AMZN might be going in loss this quarter

Message.Msg: Actually, the consensus of this quarter estimate is -8c. So, most likely it will lose money. After this quarter its PE will go up further.

Topic.Title: AMZN might be going in loss this quarter

Message.Msg: Amazon doesn't trade on current earnings (or PE), but on future earnings and guidance. I think both will be tamped down in late October. The prospect of competing with Wal*Mart (a much larger company) also has to be deflating. Long term, this company should trade at no more than 50 times earnings. If you believe the forward PE of 100 (I think that is still too high), the price should correct at least 50% at some point to the $125-150 area. But the market doesn't trade on earnings prospects always. How long this can levitate is anyone's guess, although the Walmart development and the trading pattern of the last few days must be of no little worry to the bulls.

Message.Title: AMZN will be up $10 today.
Message.Msg: Something like that. Well, stranger things have happened with this stock. Yesterday's fall was uncalled for. So getting back to 250 today (I'd call it a snap back rally) is only natural. The question is how far above that shorts can take her today. Obviously, the general market must cooperate. As of now, unfortunately, it's still in the realm that's can be termed "flat." (It's 4:25 am EST). Hopefully, the DOW futures will be up 100 points or so by 8 am EST today. Bwahahahaha . . .

Message.Title: Most of the People Here are Lunatics
Message.Msg: If you read any rambling, typo-ridden, grammatically depraved, messages on this Board, just remember: most of the people on this board are either lunatics. robots, or really, really bored retirees who think they're big-time day-traders. Don't listen to them. Simple rules: 1. Most markets trade on momentum which takes years to correct. Value invest on fundamentals and proven business models, but trade on calculated bets with stops. 2. If a company is overvalued on fundamentals and on an up-trend (higher-highs and higher lows, big ups, small downs; don't short it unless you stop yourself out at some comfortable limit. 3. If a company is overvalued on fundamentals and on a down-trend (big downs, small ups), retreating from established highs; don't buy the stock or outright short it. 4. Markets over-react on both sides. 5. Never fall in love with a company so much that you think their stock is going to make you money. I love Amazon as a company and product, but it's overvalued on fundamentals, priced for perfection, and has a lot to stumble on and figure out in its future. You'll only get burnt if you buy this downtrend. If you buy at 45x forward earnings (which is what the growth they generate dictates as well as the compressed margins that will endure for the near future) you'll do well.
Most likely down $10 for today. $180 is on the horizon. I will only consider buying AMZN when it hits $180.

Message.Title: I'm buying here
Message.Msg: Learned about shorting AMZN the hard way here months ago. Here are some facts and opinions. Take them for what they are worth. Here is what I know. PE is high. That goes without saying. I believe it is from capital investments and not a poor business model. You can decide for yourself. The stock sells for 2x annual sales volume. AAPL is a 4x. Well within reason for a growth stock. These guys dominate web retail. No debate here. They also dominate web logistics. No argument here. They are also still the price leader for the most part. They are also the kings of online media, a leader in the cloud, and in general--stoke investors imagination that they can do anything. They also happent o the most trusted name in web retail. A huge asset. All pretty obvious..here'e what may not be so obvoius... They told nearly every supplier they work with that they are taking an extra 15% margin in 2013. You what the retailers said. Thank you and may I have another. Thsi alone will have a huge impact on the bottom. I sell on AMZN. Their business has nearly doubled with us over the past 90 days. Why? Shipping and trust. The customer gets it fast and knows they can return it. I ordered headphones off AMZN at 8PM Monday and had them by 12PM Tuesday. They're amazing. People would rather buy on AMZN than the brands own site. Someone asked me on this board why I would short this stock with so much potential? I had the same silly PE feedback that everyone else had...they make no money, kindle doesn't sell, etc...all wrong. The numbers they come out with are going to be STUPIDLY good this QTR. I wouldn't want to be short going into 10/25. I also consider the fact that they are webcasting the results to be a pretty darn good sign that they have something to be proud of. This company is going nowhere but up.

I think that was way premature. There are plenty of fools who will most likely push this higher going into earnings. Sorry you lost moeny but just believing in Jeff Bezos does not justify the stock price.
Its easy to dominate a business sector when you are not concerned about profit margin. Most all stores would be packed if they priced their merchandise how AMZN does.

Topic.Title: DRAM $0.64 with $6.5M Market Cap is a Potential Multi-bagger......DRAM and AMD signed an agreement to launch an aggressive campaign to market all editions of AMD's AMD Memory modules for desktops......Per the agreement, DRAM will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk...... AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times are expected to be 525% higher than those offered by conventional products

Message.Msg: DRAM can multiply 5 times soon but AMZN will never trade North of $3000/share...... never. Advantage DRAM

Most of consumers have no/less loyalty to any retailers. They only have loyalty to the price. If you can buy same thing from other places at lower price, why would you spend more. You may argue that Amazon customer service is better. There are many better than Amazon ones. Consumer Report survey shows Amazon is only 17th. Now sales tax advantage is gone. It will have big impact to Amazon retail business. Many retailers still don't collect sales tax, they will have advantage, and many of them has better rating than Amazon. Not even to mention local retails, such as Costco, and BestBuy. Regardless above argument. Amazon business by nature is low margin and no loyalty business. The only story that Amazon can sell to wall street is its revenue growth(not even include profit growth). Once its growth show sign of slow down. It will collapse. Go take a look at CSCO 10-15 year stock history. CSCO in year 2000 is over $60. Now it is $18, and also keep in mind that CSCO can make much more money at that time and now. If Amazon is no longer growth company, like CSCO today, its stock price will be traded well below $100, may be $50 or less. This quarter and next quarter projection may see slow growth because sales tax impact.

Message.Title: Earnings Season Upon Us, or put another way: "I see a BAD MOON RISING!"
Message.Msg: "Later today (Friday) in the U.S., J.P. Morgan (JPM) will release its earnings," said Kenichi Hirano, operating officer at Tachibana Securities in Tokyo. "Then we'll have more earnings next week, and the expectations are not high. If results are disappointing, stocks will sell off, so that makes it difficult to buy now."

Message.Title: Hey geegee, the futurez are up again
Message.Msg: How do you think that will impact tomorrows trade? Geegee iz sleeping now, he stayed up last night spnanking hiz monkey on the furturez before he took a bloodbath on selling his scam weekly call optionz at a massive realized loss.... Dummy.

My friends, Not sure how selling products at 40-50% margins from warehouses is a low margin business.They built out their infrastructure now to the point where their profits will be huge and they'll be 10 years ahead of everyone else. To think people aren't loyal to AMZN is just silly. I'm all in before the earnings. Get ready to be blown away. Do you think Bezos is so stupid that he doesn;t realize it's time to start showing some margins? Of course he does...

Pumperz are actually pursuing a value case for owning this manipulated pig, while ignoring tge obvious: Institional distribution of this stock as it put in new all time highs on waining volume which has increased dramatically as it falls A well established and rather ugly looking down trend that has been in place for 1 month and is comprised of divergent rsi at the top followed by repeat sessions of lower highs with lower lows, and a sound shattering of the 50dsma as this pig makes a trip down to the 200 sma without blinking and before thinking Bounceses like todays open are a gift to shorts...

AMZN is trading at 35X TTM operating cash flow (and that is BEFORE having to collect taxes and a resurgent WalMart, Best Buy matching price on big ticket items, etc). That's cuts through all the #$%$ about 3P margins etc. Any fund not taking 10-20% off the table is grossly negligent. $100B retailers simply do not and cannot capture enough value to justify these scam multiples...

No worries tech - sane shorts are going to make a fortune on this one... No need to chastize pumperz and baggiez or yell at knife catcherz... Punishment iz already under way... They have been dragged out to the woodshed and tied down.... The got a mid dose of amperage to the sack and a finger smashed with a ping hammer... Tomorrow a tooth gets drilled to expose some nerves and give em a poke... Next week will be focused on knee caps and boarding.... Goody
